text.text_translated:
Springsteen is the last name of the singer Bruce Springsteen.  
He is a singer from the USA.  
He is one of the best-selling album artists.  
He still makes chart-topping, stadium-filling new music.  
He remains at the top of his game.  
He is in his late 60s.  
It doesn’t surprise me at all.  
His music tells us our most important stories about ourselves.  
Born in the USA is his famous album.  
Those stories are in the album.  
They were always important.  
They are still important today.

feedback.feedback:
FAIL: Fidelity Failure. The BERTScore of 0.8809 is below the required 0.90, indicating a significant loss of key words and phrasing from the original.
1. The phrase "Unlike many other best-selling album artists" was reduced to "He is one of the best-selling album artists," removing the contrasting emphasis.
2. The combined idea "chart-topping, stadium-filling new music and remains at the top of his game" was split into separate sentences, losing the linked nuance.
3. "most fundamental stories" was changed to "most important stories," which weakens the original meaning.
Suggestion: Reinstate the full contrasting phrase "Unlike many other best-selling album artists".
Suggestion: Preserve the compound construction "chart-topping, stadium-filling new music and remains at the top of his game".
Suggestion: Restore the term "fundamental" to maintain the original nuance.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Springsteen is the name of the singer Bruce Springsteen.  
He is a singer from the USA.  
He is a best-selling artist.  
Many best-selling artists do not release new music.  
But he still releases chart-topping, stadium-filling new music.  
He is in his late 60s.  
He is still at the top of his game.  
He tells important stories about us.  
When you listen to Born in the USA, you hear these stories.  
They are as relevant today as they ever were.
